name: Iron Skillet Baked Potatoes
author: ANTILOPE
summary: These potatoes are baked cut-side-down in a cast iron skillet. This results in a potato with a slightly golden brown crust on the cut side and a delicious, roasted flavor. Potatoes can be served with sour cream, shredded cheese, etc.
ingredients: 4 medium potatoes, scrubbed and sliced length-wise
directions: Pour canola oil evenly into the bottom of a room-temperature, 10-inch cast iron skillet
Sprinkle rosemary and seasoned salt evenly over the canola oil
Place potatoes, cut-side down, in 1 layer in the bottom of the skillet
Press down on potatoes so cut-side is coated in canola oil
Place the cold skillet into a cold oven
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Bake until potatoes are easily pierced with a fork, about 45 minutes
